snippet: The long-delayed trial of Charles Ng on charges of torturing and killing 12 people began here today, with the prosecutor told jurors that investigators found a ''killing field'' in a Calaveras County cabin allegedly used by Mr. Ng.     Mr. Ng, 37,...
lead_paragraph: The long-delayed trial of Charles Ng on charges of torturing and killing 12 people began here today, with the prosecutor told jurors that investigators found a ''killing field'' in a Calaveras County cabin allegedly used by Mr. Ng. Mr. Ng, 37, is accused of luring people to the cabin in the Sierra Nevada foothills in 1984 and 1985, where seven men, three women and two babies were held in homemade cells, tortured and killed.
abstract: Long-delayed trial of Charles Ng on charges of torturing and killing 12 people between 1984 and 1985 begins in Santa Ana, Calif (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Californian on Trial In 80's Multiple Murders
